body_html:
Here are two traces.
The first one for

import fasttext
import torch

test-import-fasttest-import-torch.txt
Note that this one looks for files in the directory /opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1524586445097/work/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/detail/, that do not exist.

(It may be important to notice that I created my local conda env with conda env create -p $HOME/conda/pytorch, because on the cluster I don't have sufficient permissions to run conda env create without a local directory; while on my laptop -- where I don't have any segfault problem -- I created it without -p)

The second trace is for the python script

import torch
import fasttext

test-import-torch-import-fasttext.txt

Here it looks for the file $HOME/conda/pytorch/include/python3.6m/pybind11/detail/class.h, which exists, but it still segfaults...

As for the docker image, I've never done that, and I'm not even sure that I can do it on the cluster, with the few permissions I have.

body:
Here are two traces.
The first one for
```
import fasttext
import torch
```
[test-import-fasttest-import-torch.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/2185753/test-import-fasttest-import-torch.txt)
Note that this one looks for files in the directory `/opt/conda/conda-bld/pytorch_1524586445097/work/third_party/pybind11/include/pybind11/detail/`, that do not exist.

(It may be important to notice that I created my local conda env with `conda env create -p $HOME/conda/pytorch`, because on the cluster I don't have sufficient permissions to run conda env create without a local directory; while on my laptop -- where I don't have any segfault problem -- I created it without -p)



The second trace is for the python script
```
import torch
import fasttext
```
[test-import-torch-import-fasttext.txt](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/files/2185754/test-import-torch-import-fasttext.txt)

Here it looks for the file $HOME/conda/pytorch/include/python3.6m/pybind11/detail/class.h, which exists, but it still segfaults...

As for the docker image, I've never done that, and I'm not even sure that I can do it on the cluster, with the few permissions I have.
